intro: Opithandra dinghushanensis, commonly known as the Dinghushan opithandra, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in subtropical forest environments, often growing on rocky slopes or in shaded understories. Its botanical significance lies in its limited distribution and potential role in ecological studies of biodiversity. Opithandra dinghushanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and conservation status.
